步.definition: a step; a pace; walk; march; stages in a process; situation

步人後塵.definition: to follow in other people's footsteps

步子太大，容易扯著蛋.pinyin: bu4 zi5 tai4 da4 , rong2 yi4 che3 zhe5 dan4
步子太大，容易扯著蛋.definition: if you take too big a stride, you could easily rip your balls (catchphrase) (line spoken by actor 葛優|葛优[Ge3 You1] in the 2010 action comedy movie 讓子彈飛|让子弹飞[Rang4 Zi3 dan4 Fei1]); (fig.) take things one step at a time

步履維艱.definition: to have difficulty walking (idiom); to walk with difficulty

步履蹣跚.definition: (idiom) to walk unsteadily; to hobble along

步斗踏罡.definition: to worship the astral deities (idiom, refers to Daoist astrology)

步步.definition: step by step; at every step

步步為營.definition: to advance gradually and entrench oneself at every step; to consolidate at every step

步步高陞.definition: to climb step by step; to rise steadily; on the up and up

步武.definition: to walk in someone's steps; to follow in someone's footsteps (literary); a step (literary)

步罡踏斗.definition: to worship the astral deities (idiom, refers to Daoist astrology)

步行.definition: to go on foot; to walk

步足.definition: ambulatory leg (of a crab, lobster, spider etc)

步輦.definition: (literary) palanquin; sedan chair; (literary) to ride in a palanquin

步韻.definition: to write a poem using another poem's rhymes
